title: Online Intensive Workshop on Environmental Health Mathematical Modeling for Strengthening Practitioner Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational environmental health concepts, practical experience, and high school-level mathematics knowledge (statistics, graph interpretation, basic equation comprehension)
context.additional_context: Provides mobile-optimized content to strengthen job relevance for current practitioners, with a hands-on design emphasizing mathematical modeling (probability, statistics, data analysis) in environmental health.

learning_goals: Learners explain at least three quantitative analysis methods using probability distributions and statistical models when assessing exposure to hazardous materials in industrial settings.
Learners design community environmental risk communication strategies based on mobile scenarios and express graphs and analysis results using data visualization tools.
Learners perform exposure assessment modeling practice using digital tools (e.g., calculation software) accessible via smartphones and interpret equation-based results.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
